Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory William Hogan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gregory William Hogan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gregory William Hogan was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory William Hogan

records.addlTxt: From DE on 12/20/19 inquiring where the $2000 bail went & that he was notified by WI DOR that $700 of his taxes were intercepted. Ret'd call to DE today & advised him that $1070.50 was applied to pay off his court costs & atty fees on 19CF216, which left a remaining bal of $929.50. DE was advised that he had an outstanding bal of $908.41 on other cases (17CF725, 16CF269, 15CF572) & a letter was sent to Annette Hogan (bond poster) advising her that the judge has approved for his balances to be pd w/the remainder of the bail unless she objects, and because she didn't, the money was applied leaving a refund bal of $21.09. DE was advised that I would locate the refund & have it issued to Annette in the near future. DE was also advised that he does not show any balances due to the Clerk of Court at this time. DE to call back next wk re: tax return as we have not rec'd any notice or any add'l funds. DE verified address on file. jaf
Applied  $390.41 to payment plan balance due on 16CF269 & 15CF572 from 19CF216 per SRN. cah
Applied refund of $557 from Case 18CF276 to balance due on 15CF572, Adj 19A 097320, per RMW. cah

DE's mother called to make pymt over the ph. DE's mother was given the pymt options, was advised that the DE is on 2 separate Pymt Plans, & that pymts need to be pd separately or noted separately.  DE's mother was given the case #'s & I verified the amts due for ea one along w/the due dates. Includes 15CF572, 16CF269.  jaf

From Annette Hogan on 9-24-18 @ 3:30 pm stating she needs to make a pymt for her son's court fee.  Ret'd call to Annette today & she advised me that she made the pymt yesterday.  Annette was advised that the pymt was due the 1st of Sept, the DE has been sent a Coll notice, & if he were to miss another pymt, he will be sent to the Coll Agency immediately.  Annette stated she would notify her son.  Includes 15CF572, 16CF269.  jaf
SDC 30-day notice sent this date. cah

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Adam P Nero, DF: Gregory William Hogan appeared.  Case recalled and includes case 15CF572, 16CF269, 16CF499, 17CF725 & 17CF474.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  State files an amended Information for 15CF572 that amends Ct. 1 4th OWI to a misdemeanor.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 17CF725 & NO CONTEST to the amended Ct. 1 in 15CF572 (Misdemeanor 4th OWI).  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 in 17CF725 & the amended Ct. 1 in 15CF572 (Misdemeanor OWI 4th). On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2, Ct. 3, Ct. 4, Ct, 5, Ct. 6 & Ct. 7 in 17CF725 and Ct. 2 and C. 3 in 15CF572 and Crt. dismisses 17CF474 & 16CF499.  DA Nieskes advises 16CF269 was previously sentenced.   Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 in 17CF725
W/S 2 years probation is concurrent with any current probation
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.
- Treatment as directed by the probation agent and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250.00 for the DNA surcharge apply monies on any of the files and the remaining balance to be paid through probation
- DE to sign up for probation before being released
- DE to provide the DRC with a DNA sample
-20 days to appeal


Amended Ct. 1 in 15CF572
- DE sentenced to 60 days in the St. Croix County Jail credit for time served
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- 24 months driver's license revocation
- 24 months IID
- F/F and court costs of $2,122.00 apply monies on any of the files and the remaining balance to be paid through probation
- DE to provide the DRC with a DNA sample
- 20 days to appeal
Status conference on January 3, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

*AMENDED*

INCLUDES CASE 16CF499 & 15CF570

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Day Report Center agreement on today's date. I further understand that I am required to submit to random ETG testing, at least 1 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in an arrest warrant and/or referral for criminal charges.  

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing pursuant to the Day Report Center protocols. If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive.   COURT AGREES TO WAIVE THE COSTS OF TESTING.
